description: Don Chandima Gamage and other Vs R.M. Ranjith Madduma Bandara, Secretary - Samagi Jana Balawegaya and seven others before Hon. K.M.G.H. Kulatunga, J.
parties: Don Chandima Gamage and other Vs R.M. Ranjith Madduma Bandara, Secretary - Samagi Jana Balawegaya and seven others
keywords: Local government elections • Women members’ quota • Proportional representation • Legitimate expectation • Wednesbury unreasonableness • Statutory interpretation • Negative prohibitory provisions • Irrationality / unreasonableness • Franchise • Sovereignty of the People
legistation: Local Authorities Elections Ordinance (as amended) - Section 27F(1): Mandates not less than 25% women representation in each local authority. - Section 65AA(2)–(4): Governs allocation and apportionment of women members among political parties and independent groups. Section 65A: Provisions on apportionment of elected and returned members. • Article 99A of the Constitution - Method of proportional apportionment applied mutatis mutandis under Section 65AA(3). • Article 3 of the Constitution - Sovereignty of the people and the franchise.
